Detailed Description

Represents an audio channel \ audio source on a conventional mixer

Member Function Documentation

short audiochannel::getAudio (  char *  buffer,
unsigned long  bytes
) 
 

Gets audio from the cache.

Fills a user defined buffer with a user specified number of audio bytes

Parameters:
buffer Pointer to a user-allocated buffer
bytes The number of bytes to put into the buffer
Returns:
The number of bytes actually output (should match)

unsigned long audiochannel::getPos (   ) 
 

Gets the current position in the audio file.

The position in the audio file will be the position at the end of the last getAudio request.

Returns:
Position in samples of the current position in the audio file

float audiochannel::getVolume (  unsigned long  smpl  ) 
 

Gets the current volume setting.

Computes the intended volume of the channel, based on the current volume and any fades which may have been scheduled. This is usually called by the audiomixer to which the channel belongs when mixing together the audio.

Parameters:
smpl The sample for which the intended volume is requested
Returns:
The intended volume of the given sample

bool audiochannel::isLoaded (   ) 
 

Returns the state of the loaded audio track.

Returns true if the channel has an audio track loaded and is good for reading. If the file fails to be readable, or load has not been called on an instance, then this will return false

Returns:
true if a track is loaded and good for reading

void audiochannel::load (  string  filename,
long  start_smpl,
long  end_smpl
) 
 

Loads an audio file.

Loads an audio track into the channel. The file is not pre-cached until playback is started.

Parameters:
filename the full path to the file to load
start_smpl the first sample in the file to commence playback with. allows for skipping bits of the track.
end_smpl the last sample to playback.

void audiochannel::notify (   ) 
 

Notify when playback has finished.

Sleeps (blocks execution of the calling thread) until playback of the current file is complete.

void audiochannel::notify_cache (   ) 
 

Notify when caching of the file has finished.

Sleeps (blocks execution of the calling thread) until caching of the current file is complete. This is usually used to destroy the caching thread safely. However, loading a new track before playback is complete will terminate the output of the current track as all parameters are reset on load.

void audiochannel::pause (   ) 
 

Pauses playback.

Specifies that null samples should be output instead of audio from file Audio counters are not reset, allowing playback to be resumed from the current position.

void audiochannel::play (   ) 
 

Initiates playing of the loaded audio file.

This specifies that the output should be from the audio file, as opposed to null samples which are output when not playing

void audiochannel::resume (   ) 
 

Resume playback.

Specifies to resume outputting the audio file from the previous position

void audiochannel::scheduleFade (  unsigned long  start_smpl,
float  start_pct,
unsigned long  end_smpl,
float  end_pct
) 
 

Schedules a fade.

Stores the parameters of a fade, so they can be accounted for in the getVolume routine.

Parameters:
start_smpl Specifies the sample at which to start the fade
start_pct Specifies the percentage of maximum amplitude at which to start the fade
end_smpl Specifies the sample at which the fade ends
end_pct Specifies the percentage of maximum amplitude at end

void audiochannel::scheduleTrigger (  unsigned long  smpl,
audiochannel *  ch
) 
 

Schedules a trigger.

Stores the parameters of a channel which is to be triggered at the correct time

Parameters:
smpl The sample at which to trigger the channel
ch A pointer to the channel which is to be triggered

void audiochannel::seek (  long  position  ) 
 

Seeks to the required sample in the audio file.

Commences reading the audio file at a different position in the file, resetting the cache so new audio begins outputting immediately.

Parameters:
position The position in samples to seek to

void audiochannel::setVolume (  float  vol  ) 
 

Sets the current volume setting.

Parameters:
vol The volume to apply

void audiochannel::stop (   ) 
 

Stops playback.

The audio file is no longer output. All counters are reset.

void audiochannel::trigger (  unsigned long  smpl  ) 
 

Triggers other channels if appropriate.

Determines if any scheduled triggers should trigger and if so, triggers playback on the channel specified.

Parameters:
smpl The sample at which triggers should be considered
